:   Fields that are a direct child of a [group]{.title-ref} element
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
placeholder

The help message to display on *empty* fields. It can replace field
labels in complex forms. However, it *should not* be an example of data,
as users may confuse placeholder text with filled fields.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
mode

The comma-separated list of display modes (view types) to use for the
field\'s linked records. Allowed modes are: [list]{.title-ref},
[form]{.title-ref}, [kanban]{.title-ref}, and [graph]{.title-ref}.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [list]{.title-ref}

scope
:   `~odoo.fields.One2many`{.interpreted-text role="class"} and
    `~odoo.fields.Many2many`{.interpreted-text role="class"} fields
:::

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
class

The [HTML class](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML_attribute) to set on
the generated element.

The styling uses the [Bootstrap](https://getbootstrap.com) framework and
`UI icons
<reference/user_interface/ui_icons>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
Common Odoo classes include:

- \`oe_inline\`: prevents the usual line break following fields, and
  limits their span;
- [oe_left]{.title-ref}, \`oe_right\`:
  [floats](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/float) the
  element to the corresponding direction;
- [oe_read_only]{.title-ref}, \`oe_edit_only\`: only displays the
  element in the corresponding form mode;
- \`oe_avatar\`: for image fields, displays images as an \"avatar\" (max
  90x90 square);
- \`oe_stat_button\`: defines a particular rendering to dynamically
  display information while being clickable to target an action.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"fname\" class=\"oe_inline oe_left oe_avatar\"/\>
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"ACTION\" class=\"oe_stat_button\" icon=\"FONT_AWESOME\" help=\"HELP\"\>

:   

    \<div class=\"o_field_widget o_stat_info\"\>

    :   \<span class=\"o_stat_value\"\>\<FIELD/\>\</span\> \<span
        class=\"o_stat_text\"\>TEXT\</span\>

    \</div\>

\</button\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
filename

The name of the related field providing the name of the file.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}

scope
:   `~odoo.fields.Binary`{.interpreted-text role="class"} fields
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
password

Whether the field stores a password and thus its data should not be
displayed.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}

scope
:   `~odoo.fields.Char`{.interpreted-text role="class"} fields
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
kanban_view_ref

The XMLID of the specific Kanban
`view record <view_records>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} that should
be used when selecting records in a mobile environment.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}

scope
:   Relational fields
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
default_focus

Whether the field is focused when the view opens. It can be applied to
only one field of a view.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
:::

::::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Relational fields <studio/fields/relational-fields>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} nodes can contain specific subviews.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"children_ids\"\>

:   

    \<list\>

    :   \<field name=\"name\"/\>

    \</list\> \<form\> \<field name=\"id\"/\> \<field name=\"name\"/\>
    \</form\>

\</field\>
:::
:::::

#### \`label\`: display field labels {#reference/view_architectures/form/label}

When a
`field <reference/view_architectures/form/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} component is not placed directly inside a
`group <reference/view_architectures/form/group>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, or when its [nolabel]{.title-ref} attribute is set, the
field\'s label is not automatically displayed alongside its value. The
[label]{.title-ref} component is the manual alternative of displaying
the label of a field.

``` xml
<form>
    <div class="col col-md-auto">
        <label for="FIELD_NAME" string="LABEL"/>
        <div>
            <field name="FIELD_NAME" class="oe_inline"/>
        </div>
    </div>
</form>
```

The [label]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
for

The reference to the field associated with the label. It can be either
the name of the field, or its id (the [id]{.title-ref} attribute set on
the `field <reference/view_architectures/form/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}).

When there are several occurrences of the same field in the view, and
there are several [label]{.title-ref} components associated with these
field nodes, these labels must have unique [for]{.title-ref} attribute;
in this case, referencing the [id]{.title-ref} attribute of the
corresponding field nodes.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The label to display.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   The field\'s label coming from the field definition on the model
:::

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
class

The [HTML class](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML_attribute) to set on
the generated element.

The styling uses the [Bootstrap](https://getbootstrap.com) framework and
`UI icons
<reference/user_interface/ui_icons>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
Common Odoo classes include:

- \`oe_inline\`: prevents the usual line break following fields, and
  limits their span;
- [oe_left]{.title-ref}, \`oe_right\`:
  [floats](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/float) the
  element to the corresponding direction;
- [oe_read_only]{.title-ref}, \`oe_edit_only\`: only displays the
  element in the corresponding form mode;
- \`oe_avatar\`: for image fields, displays images as an \"avatar\" (max
  90x90 square);
- \`oe_stat_button\`: defines a particular rendering to dynamically
  display information while being clickable to target an action.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"fname\" class=\"oe_inline oe_left oe_avatar\"/\>
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"ACTION\" class=\"oe_stat_button\" icon=\"FONT_AWESOME\" help=\"HELP\"\>

:   

    \<div class=\"o_field_widget o_stat_info\"\>

    :   \<span class=\"o_stat_value\"\>\<FIELD/\>\</span\> \<span
        class=\"o_stat_text\"\>TEXT\</span\>

    \</div\>

\</button\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

#### \`button\`: display action buttons {#reference/view_architectures/form/button}

``` xml
<form>
    <button type="object" name="ACTION" string="LABEL"/>
    <button type="object" name="ACTION" icon="FONT_AWESOME"/>
</form>
```

The [button]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
type

The type of the button indicating how it behaves. It can have two
different values:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
object

Call a method on the view\'s model. The button\'s [name]{.title-ref} is
the method that is called with the current record ID and the current
[context]{.title-ref}.
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
action

Load and execute an [ir.actions]{.title-ref} action record. The
button\'s [name]{.title-ref} is the XMLID of the action to load. The
[context]{.title-ref} is extended with the view\'s model (as
[active_model]{.title-ref}) and with the current record (as
[active_id]{.title-ref}).
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"action_create_new\" string=\"Create
document\"/\> \<button type=\"action\" name=\"addon.action_create_view\"
string=\"Create and Edit\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Mandatory if the [special]{.title-ref} attribute is not set

type
:   str
::::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
name

The method to call if the [type]{.title-ref} is [object]{.title-ref}.
The `XMLID <external identifier>`{.interpreted-text role="term"} of the
action to load if the [type]{.title-ref} is [action]{.title-ref}, either
in raw format or in [%(XMLID)d]{.title-ref} format.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The button\'s text if there is no [icon]{.title-ref}, the
[alt]{.title-ref} text for the icon otherwise.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"action_create_new\" string=\"Create
document\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
icon

The icon to use to display the button. See
`icons <reference/user_interface/ui_icons>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for the reference list.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"remove\" icon=\"fa-trash\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
help

The tooltip message shown when hovering with the mouse cursor.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"remove\" icon=\"fa-trash\"
help=\"Revoke\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
context

The context that is merged into the view\'s context when performing the
button\'s call, as a Python expression that evaluates to a dict.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button name=\"button_confirm\" type=\"object\"
context=\"{\'BUSINESS_KEY\': ANY}\" string=\"LABEL\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [{}]{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups

The comma-separated list of user groups to whom the element is
displayed. Users who do not belong to at least one of these groups are
unable to see the element. Groups can be prefixed with the negative
[!]{.title-ref} operator to exclude them.

::: example
``` xml
<field name="FIELD_NAME" groups="base.group_no_one,!base.group_multi_company"/>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
class

The [HTML class](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML_attribute) to set on
the generated element.

The styling uses the [Bootstrap](https://getbootstrap.com) framework and
`UI icons
<reference/user_interface/ui_icons>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
Common Odoo classes include:

- \`oe_inline\`: prevents the usual line break following fields, and
  limits their span;
- [oe_left]{.title-ref}, \`oe_right\`:
  [floats](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/float) the
  element to the corresponding direction;
- [oe_read_only]{.title-ref}, \`oe_edit_only\`: only displays the
  element in the corresponding form mode;
- \`oe_avatar\`: for image fields, displays images as an \"avatar\" (max
  90x90 square);
- \`oe_stat_button\`: defines a particular rendering to dynamically
  display information while being clickable to target an action.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"fname\" class=\"oe_inline oe_left oe_avatar\"/\>
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"ACTION\" class=\"oe_stat_button\" icon=\"FONT_AWESOME\" help=\"HELP\"\>

:   

    \<div class=\"o_field_widget o_stat_info\"\>

    :   \<span class=\"o_stat_value\"\>\<FIELD/\>\</span\> \<span
        class=\"o_stat_text\"\>TEXT\</span\>

    \</div\>

\</button\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
special

The behavior of the button for form views opened in dialog. It can have
two different values:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
save

Save the record and close the dialog.
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
cancel

Close the dialog without saving.
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button special=\"cancel\" icon=\"fa-trash\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
confirm

The confirmation message to display (and for the user to accept) before
performing the button\'s action.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button name=\"action_destroye_gate\" string=\"Send the goa\'uld\"
type=\"object\" confirm=\"Do you confirm the action?\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
data-hotkey

The hotkey
([keyboard_shortcut](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keyboard_shortcut),
similar to an
[accesskey](https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/editing.html#the-accesskey-attribute))
that is bound to the button. It is enabled when the [alt]{.title-ref}
key is pressed together with the selected character, or together with
the [shift]{.title-ref} key and the selected character when
[shift+]{.title-ref} is prepended to the value.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"action_confirm\" string=\"Confirm\"
data-hotkey=\"c\"/\> \<button type=\"object\" name=\"action_tear\"
string=\"Tear the sheet\" data-hotkey=\"shift+k\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

#### Chatter widget {#reference/view_architectures/form/chatter}

The `chatter widget <reference/mixins/mail/chatter>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} is the communication and log tool allowing to email
colleagues and customers directly from a record (task, order, invoice,
event, note\...).

It is added with a [div]{.title-ref} element with the class
[oe_chatter]{.title-ref} when the model inherits the
[mail.thread]{.title-ref} mixin.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<form\>

:   

    \<sheet\>

    :   \...

    \</sheet\> \<div class=\"oe_chatter\"\> \<field
    name=\"message_follower_ids\"/\> \<field name=\"activity_ids\"/\>
    \<field name=\"message_ids\" options=\"OPTIONS\"/\> \</div\>

\</form\>
:::

#### Attachments preview widget {#reference/view_architectures/form/attachment}

The attachment preview widget is added with an *empty* [div]{.title-ref}
element with the class [o_attachment_preview]{.title-ref}.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<form\>

:   

    \<sheet\>

    :   \...

    \</sheet\> \<div class=\"o_attachment_preview\"/\>

\<form\>
:::

### Structural components {#reference/view_architectures/form/structural}

Structural components provide structure or \"visual\" features with
little logic. They are used as elements or sets of elements in form
views.

Form views accept the following children structural components: `group
<reference/view_architectures/form/group>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`sheet <reference/view_architectures/form/sheet>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`notebook <reference/view_architectures/form/notebook>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`notebook <reference/view_architectures/form/notebook>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`newline <reference/view_architectures/form/newline>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`separator <reference/view_architectures/form/separator>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`header <reference/view_architectures/form/header>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`footer <reference/view_architectures/form/footer>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`reference/view_architectures/form/button_container`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and
`reference/view_architectures/form/title_container`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Placeholders are denoted in all caps.

#### \`group\`: define columns layouts {#reference/view_architectures/form/group}

The [group]{.title-ref} element is used to define column layouts in
forms. By default, groups define 2 columns, and most direct children of
groups take a single column.

`field <reference/view_architectures/form/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} elements that are direct children of groups display a
[label]{.title-ref} by default, and the label and the field itself have
a [colspan]{.title-ref} of [1]{.title-ref} each.

Children are laid out horizontally (they try to fill the next column
before changing row).

``` xml
<form>
    <group>
        ...
    </group>
</form>
```

The [group]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The title displayed for the group.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
col

The number of columns in a [group]{.title-ref}.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   int

default
:   [2]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
colspan

The number of columns taken by a child element.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   int

default
:   [1]{.title-ref}
:::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/form_group.svg){.align-center} |
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                    |
| <group>                                                    |
|     <field name="a" string="custom"/>                      |
|     <field name="b"/>                                      |
| </group>                                                   |
| <group string="title 1">                                   |
|     <group string="title 2">                               |
|         <field name="c"/>                                  |
|         <field name="d"/>                                  |
|     </group>                                               |
|     <group>                                                |
|         <field name="e"/>                                  |
|         <field name="f"/>                                  |
|         <field name="g"/>                                  |
|     </group>                                               |
| </group>                                                   |
| <group col="12">                                           |
|     <group colspan="8">                                    |
|         <field name="h"/>                                  |
|     </group>                                               |
|     <group colspan="4">                                    |
|         <field name="i"/>                                  |
|     </group>                                               |
| </group>                                                   |
| ```                                                        |
+------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### \`sheet\`: make the layout responsive {#reference/view_architectures/form/sheet}

The [sheet]{.title-ref} element can be used as a direct child of the
`form
<reference/view_architectures/form>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} root
element for a narrower and more responsive form layout (centered page,
margin\...). It usually contains `group
<reference/view_architectures/form/group>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
elements.

``` xml
<form>
    <sheet>
        ...
    </sheet>
</form>
```

#### [notebook]{.title-ref} & \`page\`: add tabbed sections {#reference/view_architectures/form/notebook}

The [notebook]{.title-ref} element defines a tabbed section. Each tab is
defined through a [page]{.title-ref} child element.

The [notebook]{.title-ref} element should not be placed within
[group]{.title-ref} elements.

``` xml
<form>
    <notebook>
        <page string="LABEL">
            ...
        </page>
    </notebook>
</form>
```

The [page]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The title of the tab.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   [str]{.title-ref}

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+---------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/form_notebook.svg){.align-center} |
+---------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                       |
| <form>                                                        |
|     <notebook>                                                |
|         <page string="Page1">                                 |
|             ...                                               |
|         </page>                                               |
|         <page string="Page2">                                 |
|             ...                                               |
|         </page>                                               |
|     </notebook>                                               |
| </form>                                                       |
| ```                                                           |
+---------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### \`newline\`: start new group rows {#reference/view_architectures/form/newline}

The [newline]{.title-ref} element is used within
`group <reference/view_architectures/form/group>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} elements to end the current row early and immediately switch
to a new row, without filling any remaining column beforehand.

``` xml
<form>
    <group>
        ...
        <newline/>
        ...
    </group>
</form>
```

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/form_newline.svg){.align-center} |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                      |
| <form>                                                       |
|     <group string="Title 1">                                 |
|         <group string="Title 1.1">...</group>                |
|         <newline/>                                           |
|         <group string="Title 1.2">...</group>                |
|         <group string="Title 1.3">...</group>                |
|     </group>                                                 |
| </form>                                                      |
| ```                                                          |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### \`separator\`: add horizontal spacing {#reference/view_architectures/form/separator}

The [separator]{.title-ref} element adds vertical spacing between
elements within a group.

``` xml
<form>
    ...
    <separator/>
    ...
</form>
```

The [\<separator\>]{.title-ref} element can have the following
attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The title as a section title.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   [str]{.title-ref}

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+----------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/form_separator.svg){.align-center} |
+----------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                        |
| <form>                                                         |
|     <group>                                                    |
|         <FIELD/>                                               |
|         <separator string="Title 1"/>                          |
|         <FIELD/>                                               |
|         <group>                                                |
|             <FIELD/>                                           |
|             <separator string="Title 2"/>                      |
|             <FIELD/>                                           |
|         </group>                                               |
|         <group>                                                |
|             <FIELD/>                                           |
|             <FIELD/>                                           |
|         </group>                                               |
|     </group>                                                   |
| </form>                                                        |
| ```                                                            |
+----------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The [separator]{.title-ref} element can be used to achieve visual
separation between elements within the same inner [group]{.title-ref}
element while keeping them horizontally aligned.
::::

#### \`header\`: display workflow buttons and a status {#reference/view_architectures/form/header}

The [header]{.title-ref} element combined with the
`sheet <reference/view_architectures/form/sheet>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} element provides a full-width location above the sheet
itself generally used to display workflow
`button <reference/view_architectures/form/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} elements and a `field
<reference/view_architectures/form/field>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
element rendered as status widget.

``` xml
<form>
    <header>
        <BUTTONS/>
    </header>
    <sheet>
        ...
    </sheet>
</form>
```

::: example
``` xml
<header>
    <button string="Reset" type="object" name="set_draft" invisible="state != 'done'"/>
    <field name="state" widget="statusbar" statusbar_visible="draft,posted" options="{'clickable': 1}"/>
</header>
```
:::

#### \`footer\`: display dialog buttons {#reference/view_architectures/form/footer}

The [footer]{.title-ref} element is used to display
`buttons <reference/view_architectures/form/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} elements at the end of dialogs.

``` xml
<form>
    <sheet>
        ...
    </sheet>
    <footer>
        <BUTTONS/>
    </footer>
</form>
```

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<footer\>

:   \<button string=\"Save\" special=\"save\"/\> \<button
    string=\"Feature action\" type=\"object\" name=\"my_action\"
    class=\"btn-primary\"/\> \<button string=\"Discard\"
    special=\"cancel\"/\>

\</footer\>
:::

When no [footer]{.title-ref} element is specified, the view\'s standard
buttons (like Save or Discard) will be present by default. It is also
possible to avoid replacing the standard buttons in form or x2many
dialogs by using the [replace]{.title-ref} attribute. This attribute
defaults to [True]{.title-ref} if not specified but setting it to
[False]{.title-ref} (or 0) will make it so that the specified
[footer]{.title-ref} will be added next to the default buttons instead
of replacing them.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<footer replace=\"0\"\>

:   \<button string=\"Custom added action\" type=\"object\"
    name=\"my_action\" class=\"btn-primary\"/\>

\</footer\>
:::

#### Buttons container {#reference/view_architectures/form/button_container}

A `button <reference/view_architectures/form/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} elements container can be created with a [div]{.title-ref}
element with the class [button_box]{.title-ref}.

``` xml
<form>
    <div name="button_box">
        <BUTTONS/>
    </div>
<form>
```

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/form_button_box.svg){.align-center}           |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                                   |
| <form>                                                                    |
|     <div name="button_box">                                               |
|         <button type="edit" name="edit" icon="fa-edit" string="Button1"/> |
|         <button type="object" name="my_action" icon="fa-dollar">          |
|             <field name="total_inv" widget="statinfo" string="Invoices"/> |
|         </button>                                                         |
|     </div>                                                                |
| <form>                                                                    |
| ```                                                                       |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### Title container {#reference/view_architectures/form/title_container}

A title
`field <reference/view_architectures/form/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} element container can be created with a [div]{.title-ref}
element with the class [oe_title]{.title-ref}.

``` xml
<form>
    <sheet>
        <div class="oe_title">
            <h1><FIELD/></h1>
        </div>
    </sheet>
<form>
```

## Settings {#reference/view_architectures/settings}

Settings views are a customization of the
`form <reference/view_architectures/form>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
view. They are used to display settings in a centralized place. They
differ from generic form views in that they have a search bar and a
sidebar.

::: example
``` xml
<app string="CRM" name="crm">
    <setting type="header" string="Foo">
        <field name="foo" title="Foo?."/>
        <button name="nameAction" type="object" string="Button"/>
    </setting>
    <block title="Title of group Bar">
        <setting help="this is bar" documentation="/applications/technical/web/settings/this_is_a_test.html">
            <field name="bar"/>
        </setting>
        <setting string="This is Big BAR" company_specific="1">
            <field name="bar"/>
        </setting>
    </block>
    <block title="Title of group Foo">
        <setting string="Personalize setting" help="this is full personalize setting">
            <div>This is a different setting</div>
        </setting>
    </block>
</app>
```
:::

### Components {#reference/view_architectures/settings/components}

Settings views accept the
`field <reference/view_architectures/form/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `label
<reference/view_architectures/form/label>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
and `button
<reference/view_architectures/form/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} elements of `form
<reference/view_architectures/form>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
views, as well as three additional children elements:
`app <reference/view_architectures/settings/app>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `block
<reference/view_architectures/settings/block>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and `setting
<reference/view_architectures/settings/setting>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Placeholders are denoted in all caps.

#### \`app\`: declare the application {#reference/view_architectures/settings/app}

The [app]{.title-ref} element is used to declare the application on the
settings view. It creates an entry with the logo of the application on
the sidebar of the view. It also acts as delimiter when searching.

``` xml
<form>
    <app string="NAME" name="TECHNICAL_NAME">
    ...
    </app>
</form>
```

The [app]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The name of the application.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
name

The technical name of the application (the name of the module).

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
logo

The [relative path](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL) to the logo.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   [path](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Path_(computing))

default
:   A path computed with the [name]{.title-ref} attribute:
    `/{name}/static/description/icon.png`{.interpreted-text role="file"}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups

The comma-separated list of user groups to whom the element is
displayed. Users who do not belong to at least one of these groups are
unable to see the element. Groups can be prefixed with the negative
[!]{.title-ref} operator to exclude them.

::: example
``` xml
<field name="FIELD_NAME" groups="base.group_no_one,!base.group_multi_company"/>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

#### \`block\`: declare a group of settings {#reference/view_architectures/settings/block}

The [block]{.title-ref} element is used to declare a group of settings.
This group can have a title and a description.

``` xml
<form>
    <app string="NAME" name="TECHNICAL_NAME">
        ...
        <block title="TITLE">
            ...
        </block>
        ...
    </app>
</form>
```

The [block]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
title

The title of the block of settings. One can search on its value.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
help

The description of the block of settings. One can search on its value.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups

The comma-separated list of user groups to whom the element is
displayed. Users who do not belong to at least one of these groups are
unable to see the element. Groups can be prefixed with the negative
[!]{.title-ref} operator to exclude them.

::: example
``` xml
<field name="FIELD_NAME" groups="base.group_no_one,!base.group_multi_company"/>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

#### \`setting\`: declare the setting {#reference/view_architectures/settings/setting}

The [setting]{.title-ref} element is used to declare the setting itself.

The first
`field <reference/view_architectures/form/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} element in the setting is used as the main field. It is
placed on the left panel if it is a boolean field, and on the top of the
right panel otherwise. The field is also used to create the setting
label if a [string]{.title-ref} attribute is not defined.

The [setting]{.title-ref} element can also contain additional elements
(e.g., HTML). All of those elements are rendered in the right panel.

``` xml
<form>
    <app string="NAME" name="TECHNICAL_NAME">
        <block title="TITLE">
            ...
            <setting string="SETTING_NAME">
                ...
                <field name="FIELD_NAME"/>
                ...
            </setting>
            ...
        </block>
    </app>
</form>
```

The [\<setting\>]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
type

By default, a setting is visually separated on two panels (left and
right), and is used to edit a given
`field <reference/view_architectures/form/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. By defining [type=\"header\"]{.title-ref}, a special kind
of setting is rendered instead. This setting is used to modify the scope
of the other settings. For example, on the Website application, this
setting is used to indicate to which website the other settings apply.
The header setting is visually represented as a banner on top of the
screen.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The text used as the label of the setting.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   The first field\'s label
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
title

The text used as a tooltip.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
help

The description of the setting. This text is displayed just below the
setting label (with the class [text-muted]{.title-ref}).

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
company_dependent

Whether the setting is company-specific. If set, an icon is displayed
next to the setting label.

It accepts only the value [\'1\']{.title-ref}.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
documentation

The [path](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Path_(computing)) to the
documentation on the setting. If set, a clickable icon is displayed next
to the setting label. The path can be both an absolute or a [relative
path](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL). In the latter case, it is
relative to
[https://www.odoo.com/documentation/\<version\>]{.title-ref}.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   [path\_]{.title-ref}

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups

The comma-separated list of user groups to whom the element is
displayed. Users who do not belong to at least one of these groups are
unable to see the element. Groups can be prefixed with the negative
[!]{.title-ref} operator to exclude them.

::: example
``` xml
<field name="FIELD_NAME" groups="base.group_no_one,!base.group_multi_company"/>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

## List {#reference/view_architectures/list}

The root element of list views is [list]{.title-ref} (the previous name
was [tree]{.title-ref}).

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/list.svg){.align-center} |
+------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                              |
| <list>                                               |
|     ...                                              |
| </list>                                              |
| ```                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------+
:::

### Root attributes {#reference/view_architectures/list/root}

Optional attributes can be added to the root element [list]{.title-ref}
to customize the view.

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The view title. It is displayed only if you open an action that has no
name and whose target is [new]{.title-ref} (opening a dialog).

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
create

Disable/enable record creation on the view.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
edit

Disable/enable record edition on the view.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
delete

Disable/enable record deletion on the view through the
`Action`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dropdown.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
import

Disable/enable record import from data on the view.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
export_xlsx

Disable/enable record export to data on the view.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
editable

Make the view\'s records editable in-place, and allow creating new
records from a row of the list. It can have two different values:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
top

New records are created from the top of the list.
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
bottom

New records are created from the bottom of the list.
:::

The architecture for the inline
`form <reference/view_architectures/form>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
view is derived from the list view. Most attributes valid on a form
view\'s fields and buttons are thus accepted by list views, although
they may not have any meaning if the list view is non-editable.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

This behavior is disabled if the [edit]{.title-ref} attribute is set to
[False]{.title-ref}.
::::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
multi_edit

Activate the multi-editing feature that allows updating a field to the
same value for multiple records at once.

It accepts only the value [\'1\']{.title-ref}.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
open_form_view

Display a button at the end of each row to open the record in a form
view.

It has no effect if the view is non-editable.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
default_group_by

The name of the field on which the records should be grouped by default
if no grouping is specified via the action or the current
`search <reference/view_architectures/search>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
default_order

A comma-separated list of fields names that overrides the ordering
defined on the model through the
`~odoo.models.BaseModel._order`{.interpreted-text role="attr"}
attribute.

To inverse the sorting order of a field, postfix it with
[desc]{.title-ref}, separated by a space.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<list default_order=\"sequence,name desc\"\>

:   \...

\</list\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
decoration-\<style\>

The style that should be applied to matching records\' rows, as a Python
expression that evaluates to a bool.

[\<style\>]{.title-ref} must be replaced by one of [bf]{.title-ref}
(bold), [it]{.title-ref} (italic), [info]{.title-ref},
[warning]{.title-ref}, [danger]{.title-ref}, [muted]{.title-ref},
[primary]{.title-ref}, and [success]{.title-ref}.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<list decoration-danger=\"field_qty &gt; field_limit\"\>

:   \...

\</list\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
limit

The default size of a page. It must be strictly positive.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   int

default
:   [80]{.title-ref} for list views, [40]{.title-ref} for X2many lists
    in form views
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups_limit

The default number of groups on a page when the list view is grouped. It
must be strictly positive.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   int

default
:   [80]{.title-ref} for list views, [40]{.title-ref} for X2many lists
    in form views
:::

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
expand

Whether the first level of groups should be opened by default when the
list view is grouped.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

It may be slow, depending on the number of groups.
::::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
:::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
sample

Whether the view should be populated with a set of sample records if
none are found for the current model.

These fake records have heuristics for certain field names/models. For
example, a field [display_name]{.title-ref} on the model
[res.users]{.title-ref} will be populated with sample people names,
while an [email]{.title-ref} field will be in the form
[firstname.lastname@sample.demo]{.title-ref}.

The user is unable to interact with these data, and they will be
discarded as soon as an action is performed (record created, column
added, etc.).

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
:::

### Components {#reference/view_architectures/list/components}

List views accept the following children elements: `field
<reference/view_architectures/list/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `button
<reference/view_architectures/list/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `groupby
<reference/view_architectures/list/groupby>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `header
<reference/view_architectures/list/header>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `control, and create
<reference/view_architectures/list/control>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Placeholders are denoted in all caps.

#### \`field\`: display field values {#reference/view_architectures/list/field}

The [field]{.title-ref} element renders (and allows editing of,
possibly) a single field of all current records as a column.

Using the same field multiple times in a list view is not supported

``` xml
<list>
    <field name="FIELD_NAME"/>
</list>
```

The [field]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
name

The name of the field to render.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
widget

The widget used to represent the field. The selected widget can change
the way the field is rendered and/or the way it can be edited. It refers
to a Javascript implementation (an Owl component) registered to the
[fields]{.title-ref} registry.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The label of the field.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   The [string]{.title-ref} attribute of the model\'s field
:::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
optional

Make the visibility of the field optional. The field\'s column can be
hidden or shown through a button on the view\'s header.

It can have two different values:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
show

The field is shown by default.
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
hide

The field is hidden by default.
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"fname_a\" optional=\"show\"/\> \<field name=\"fname_b\"
optional=\"hide\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str
::::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
readonly

Whether the field can be modified by the user ([False]{.title-ref}) or
is read-only ([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates
to a bool.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"fname_a\" readonly=\"True\"/\> \<field name=\"fname_b\"
readonly=\"name_a in \[fname_b, parent.fname_d\]\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
required

Whether the field can be left empty ([False]{.title-ref}) or must be set
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"fname_a\" required=\"True\"/\> \<field name=\"fname_b\"
required=\"fname_c != 3\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
column_invisible

Whether the column is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

Unlike [invisible]{.title-ref}, it affects the entire column, and is
evaluated without the subtree values.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"product_is_late\"
column_invisible=\"parent.has_late_products == False\"/\> \<button
type=\"object\" name=\"action_confirm\"
column_invisible=\"context.get(\'hide_confirm\')\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups

The comma-separated list of user groups to whom the element is
displayed. Users who do not belong to at least one of these groups are
unable to see the element. Groups can be prefixed with the negative
[!]{.title-ref} operator to exclude them.

::: example
``` xml
<field name="FIELD_NAME" groups="base.group_no_one,!base.group_multi_company"/>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
decoration-\<style\>

The style that should be applied to matching records\' field, as a
Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

[\<style\>]{.title-ref} must be replaced by one of [bf]{.title-ref}
(bold), [it]{.title-ref} (italic), [info]{.title-ref},
[warning]{.title-ref}, [danger]{.title-ref}, [muted]{.title-ref},
[primary]{.title-ref}, and [success]{.title-ref}.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"name\" decoration-bf=\"1\"/\> \<field name=\"quantity\"
decoration-info=\"state == \'draft\'\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
sum, avg

The aggregate to display at the bottom of the column. The aggregation is
computed on only records that are currently displayed. The aggregation
operation must match the corresponding field\'s
[aggregator]{.title-ref}.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"sent\" sum=\"Total\" /\> \<field name=\"clicks_ratio\"
avg=\"Average\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
width

The list view always tries to optimize the available space among
columns. For some field types, this is done by enforcing a width,
depending on the field type. For instance, we know exactly the number of
pixels required to display a date, so we can ensure that a column for a
date field doesn\'t take more space than what is strictly necessary,
thus leaving the extra space for the other columns. However, the
framework can\'t guess the adequate width for every field types. For
instance, char fields can be used to encode large values, or 3-letter
country codes. In the latter case, one can set the width directly in the
arch (e.g. [width=\"40px\"]{.title-ref}). It represents the width
(always in pixels) required to render the values inside the cells. The
width of the column will then be the sum of the given value and the
cells\' left and right paddings.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
nolabel

Whether the field\'s column header should remain empty. If set, the
column will not be sortable.

It accepts only the value [\'1\']{.title-ref}

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When a list view is grouped, numeric fields are aggregated and displayed
for each group. Also, if there are too many records in a group, a pager
appears on the right of the group row. For this reason, it is a bad
practice to have a numeric field in the last column when the list view
is in a situation where it can be grouped. However, it does not pose a
problem for X2many fields in a form view, as they cannot be grouped.
::::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/list_field.svg){.align-center} |
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                    |
| <list>                                                     |
|     <field name="name" string="My Custom Name"/>           |
|     <field name="amount" sum="Total"/>                     |
|     <field name="currency_id"/>                            |
|     <field name="tax_id"/>                                 |
| </list>                                                    |
| ```                                                        |
+------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### \`button\`: display action buttons {#reference/view_architectures/list/button}

``` xml
<list>
    <button type="object" name="ACTION" string="LABEL"/>
    <button type="object" name="ACTION" icon="FONT_AWESOME"/>
</list>
```

The [button]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
type

The type of the button indicating how it behaves. It can have two
different values:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
object

Call a method on the view\'s model. The button\'s [name]{.title-ref} is
the method that is called with the current record ID and the current
[context]{.title-ref}.
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
action

Load and execute an [ir.actions]{.title-ref} action record. The
button\'s [name]{.title-ref} is the XMLID of the action to load. The
[context]{.title-ref} is extended with the view\'s model (as
[active_model]{.title-ref}) and with the current record (as
[active_id]{.title-ref}).
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"action_create_new\" string=\"Create
document\"/\> \<button type=\"action\" name=\"addon.action_create_view\"
string=\"Create and Edit\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Mandatory if the [special]{.title-ref} attribute is not set

type
:   str
::::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
name

The method to call if the [type]{.title-ref} is [object]{.title-ref}.
The `XMLID <external identifier>`{.interpreted-text role="term"} of the
action to load if the [type]{.title-ref} is [action]{.title-ref}, either
in raw format or in [%(XMLID)d]{.title-ref} format.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The button\'s text if there is no [icon]{.title-ref}, the
[alt]{.title-ref} text for the icon otherwise.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"action_create_new\" string=\"Create
document\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
icon

The icon to use to display the button. See
`icons <reference/user_interface/ui_icons>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for the reference list.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"remove\" icon=\"fa-trash\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
help

The tooltip message shown when hovering with the mouse cursor.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"remove\" icon=\"fa-trash\"
help=\"Revoke\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
context

The context that is merged into the view\'s context when performing the
button\'s call, as a Python expression that evaluates to a dict.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button name=\"button_confirm\" type=\"object\"
context=\"{\'BUSINESS_KEY\': ANY}\" string=\"LABEL\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [{}]{.title-ref}
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups

The comma-separated list of user groups to whom the element is
displayed. Users who do not belong to at least one of these groups are
unable to see the element. Groups can be prefixed with the negative
[!]{.title-ref} operator to exclude them.

::: example
``` xml
<field name="FIELD_NAME" groups="base.group_no_one,!base.group_multi_company"/>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
column_invisible

Whether the column is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

Unlike [invisible]{.title-ref}, it affects the entire column, and is
evaluated without the subtree values.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"product_is_late\"
column_invisible=\"parent.has_late_products == False\"/\> \<button
type=\"object\" name=\"action_confirm\"
column_invisible=\"context.get(\'hide_confirm\')\"/\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
class

The [HTML class](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML_attribute) to set on
the generated element.

The styling uses the [Bootstrap](https://getbootstrap.com) framework and
`UI icons
<reference/user_interface/ui_icons>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
Common Odoo classes include:

- \`oe_inline\`: prevents the usual line break following fields, and
  limits their span;
- [oe_left]{.title-ref}, \`oe_right\`:
  [floats](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/float) the
  element to the corresponding direction;
- [oe_read_only]{.title-ref}, \`oe_edit_only\`: only displays the
  element in the corresponding form mode;
- \`oe_avatar\`: for image fields, displays images as an \"avatar\" (max
  90x90 square);
- \`oe_stat_button\`: defines a particular rendering to dynamically
  display information while being clickable to target an action.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<field name=\"fname\" class=\"oe_inline oe_left oe_avatar\"/\>
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<button type=\"object\" name=\"ACTION\" class=\"oe_stat_button\" icon=\"FONT_AWESOME\" help=\"HELP\"\>

:   

    \<div class=\"o_field_widget o_stat_info\"\>

    :   \<span class=\"o_stat_value\"\>\<FIELD/\>\</span\> \<span
        class=\"o_stat_text\"\>TEXT\</span\>

    \</div\>

\</button\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/list_button.svg){.align-center}                                                                           |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                                                                                               |
| <list>                                                                                                                                |
|     <field name="name"/>                                                                                                              |
|     <button type="edit" name="edit" icon="fa-edit" title="Edit"/>                                                                     |
|     <button type="object" name="my_method" string="Button1" column_invisible="context.get('hide_button')" invisible="amount &gt; 3"/> |
|     <field name="amount"/>                                                                                                            |
|     <field name="currency_id"/>                                                                                                       |
|     <field name="tax_id"/>                                                                                                            |
| </list>                                                                                                                               |
| ```                                                                                                                                   |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### \`groupby\`: define group headers {#reference/view_architectures/list/groupby}

The [groupby]{.title-ref} element is used to define group headers with
`button
<reference/view_architectures/list/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} elements when grouping records on
`~odoo.fields.Many2one`{.interpreted-text role="attr"} fields. It also
accepts `field
<reference/view_architectures/list/field>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
elements, which can be used for modifiers. These fields thus belong on
the Many2one co-model. These extra fields are fetched in batch.

``` xml
<list>
    ...
    <groupby name="FIELD_NAME">
        <BUTTONS/>
        <FIELDS/>
    </groupby>
</list>
```

The [groupby]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
name

The name of the a `~odoo.fields.Many2one`{.interpreted-text role="attr"}
field to use as header.

A special
`button <reference/view_architectures/list/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} element with [type=\"edit\"]{.title-ref} can be defined to
open the Many2one field\'s form view.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/list_groupby.svg){.align-center}                                            |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                                                                 |
| <list>                                                                                                  |
|     <field name="name"/>                                                                                |
|     <field name="amount"/>                                                                              |
|     <field name="currency"/>                                                                            |
|     <field name="tax_id"/>                                                                              |
|                                                                                                         |
|     <groupby name="partner_id">                                                                         |
|         <button type="edit" name="edit" icon="fa-edit" title="Edit"/>                                   |
|         <field name="email"/>                                                                           |
|         <button type="object" name="my_method" string="Button1" invisible="email == 'jhon@conor.com'"/> |
|     </groupby>                                                                                          |
| </list>                                                                                                 |
| ```                                                                                                     |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Fields inside the [groupby]{.title-ref} element are used only to fetch
and store the value, but they are never displayed.
::::

#### \`header\`: display workflow buttons {#reference/view_architectures/list/header}

``` xml
<list>
    <header>
        <BUTTONS/>
    </header>
    ...
</list>
```

The [header]{.title-ref} element accepts the following children
elements:

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
button

The [button]{.title-ref} element allows defining buttons in the control
panel. It is the same element as the
`button element in list views <reference/view_architectures/list/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, but it accepts one more attribute when placed inside a
[header]{.title-ref} element:

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
display

Make the button available at all time, without having to select records.

It accepts only the value [always]{.title-ref}.

::: example
``` xml
<header>
    <button name="toDoAlways" type="object" string="Always displayed" display="always"/>
    <button name="toDoSelection" type="object" string="Displayed if selection"/>
</header>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::
:::::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/list_header.svg){.align-center}                                             |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                                                                 |
| <list>                                                                                                  |
|     <header>                                                                                            |
|         <button type="object" name="to_draft" string="Button1" invisible="context.get('hide_button')"/> |
|     </header>                                                                                           |
|     <field name="name"/>                                                                                |
|     <field name="amount"/>                                                                              |
|     <field name="currency"/>                                                                            |
|     <field name="tax_id"/>                                                                              |
| </list>                                                                                                 |
| ```                                                                                                     |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### \`control\`: customize create and delete actions {#reference/view_architectures/list/control}

The [control]{.title-ref} element allows to customize the create and
delete actions. In particular, it allows to add special create buttons
with specific contexts, to use regular view buttons as create actions,
and to make the create and delete actions available only under certain
conditions.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The [control]{.title-ref} element is only supported in list views inside
`~odoo.fields.One2many`{.interpreted-text role="class"} or
`~odoo.fields.Many2many`{.interpreted-text role="class"} fields.
::::

``` xml
<list>
   <control>
       <create string="LABEL"/>
       <BUTTONS/>
       <delete invisible="parent.is_sent">
    </control>
    ...
</list>
```

The [control]{.title-ref} element takes no attributes. It accepts the
following children elements:

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
create

The given [create]{.title-ref} elements replace the default
`Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. A
[create]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The button\'s text.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
context

The context that is merged into the view\'s context when performing the
button\'s call, as a Python expression that evaluates to a dict.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [{}]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.
The parent record and the context can be used in the expresion.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
:::
::::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
button

Like
`regular view buttons <reference/view_architectures/list/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

:::: attribute
delete

The [delete]{.title-ref} element allows to conditionnaly hide the delete
icon, row by row. There can only be one child of this type. It can have
only one attribute:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Same as for [create]{.title-ref}, except that in this case the record
itself can also be used in the expresion.
:::
::::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/list_control.svg){.align-center}                   |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                                        |
| <list>                                                                         |
|     <field name="name"/>                                                       |
|     <field name="amount"/>                                                     |
|     <field name="currency"/>                                                   |
|     <field name="tax_id"/>                                                     |
|     <control>                                                                  |
|         <create string="Add an item"/>                                         |
|         <create string="Add a section" context="{'default_type': 'section'}"/> |
|         <create string="Add a note" context="{'default_type': 'note'}"/>       |
|     </control>                                                                 |
| </list>                                                                        |
| ```                                                                            |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

## Search {#reference/view_architectures/search}

Search views are different from other view types in that they are not
used to display content. Although they apply to a specific model, they
are used to filter another view\'s content (usually aggregated views;
e.g., `reference/view_architectures/list`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
and `reference/view_architectures/graph`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}).

The root element of search views is [search]{.title-ref}.

It takes no attributes.

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+--------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/search.svg){.align-center} |
+--------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                |
| <search>                                               |
|     ...                                                |
| </search>                                              |
| ```                                                    |
+--------------------------------------------------------+
:::

### Components {#reference/view_architectures/search/components}

Search views accept the following children elements: `field
<reference/view_architectures/search/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `filter
<reference/view_architectures/search/filter>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `separator
<reference/view_architectures/search/separator>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `group
<reference/view_architectures/search/group>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and `searchpanel
<reference/view_architectures/search/searchpanel>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Placeholders are denoted in all caps.

#### \`field\`: filter based on field values {#reference/view_architectures/search/field}

The [field]{.title-ref} element defines domains or contexts with
user-provided values. When search domains are generated, field domains
are joined with each other and with filters using the **AND** operator.

``` xml
<search>
    <field name="FIELD_NAME"/>
</search>
```

The [field]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
name

The name of the field to filter on.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The label of the field.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   The [string]{.title-ref} attribute of the model\'s field
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
operator

By default, fields generate domains of the form
`[(name, {operator}, value)]`{.interpreted-text role="samp"}, where
[name]{.title-ref} is the field\'s name and [value]{.title-ref} is the
value provided by the user, possibly filtered or transformed (e.g., a
user is expected to provide the *label* of a selection field\'s value,
not the value itself).

The [operator]{.title-ref} attribute allows overriding the default
operator, which depends on the field\'s type (e.g., [=]{.title-ref} for
float fields, but [ilike]{.title-ref} for char fields and
[child_of]{.title-ref} for many2one).

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str
