default
:   [=]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
filter_domain

The domain to use as the field\'s search domain, as a Python expression
that evaluates to a `domain <reference/orm/domains>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

It can use the [self]{.title-ref} variable to inject the provided value
in the custom domain. It can be used to generate significantly more
flexible domains than with the [operator]{.title-ref} attribute alone
(e.g., search on multiple fields at once).

If both the [operator]{.title-ref} and [filter_domain]{.title-ref}
attributes are provided, [filter_domain]{.title-ref} takes precedence.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [\[\]]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
context

The context to merge into the context of the view that the search view
is targeting, as a Python expression that evaluates to a dict.

It can contain user-provided values, which are available under the
[self]{.title-ref} variable.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [{}]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
domain

The filters to apply to the completion results for fields that allow for
auto-completion (e.g., `~odoo.fields.Many2one`{.interpreted-text
role="class"}).

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [\[\]]{.title-ref}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups

The comma-separated list of user groups to whom the element is
displayed. Users who do not belong to at least one of these groups are
unable to see the element. Groups can be prefixed with the negative
[!]{.title-ref} operator to exclude them.

::: example
``` xml
<field name="FIELD_NAME" groups="base.group_no_one,!base.group_multi_company"/>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/search_field.svg){.align-center}     |
+------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                          |
| <search>                                                         |
|     <field name="name" string="My Custom Name"/>                 |
|     <field name="amount"/>                                       |
|     <field name="currency_id"/>                                  |
|     <field name="ref" filter_domain="[('name', 'like', self)]"/> |
| </search>                                                        |
| ```                                                              |
+------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### \`filter\`: create pre-defined filters {#reference/view_architectures/search/filter}

The [filter]{.title-ref} element is used to create pre-defined filters
that can be toggled in the search view. It allows adding data to the
search context `the context passed to the data view for
searching/filtering`{.interpreted-text role="dfn"}, or appending new
sections to the search filter.

``` xml
<search>
    <filter string="LABEL" domain="DOMAIN"/>
</search>
```

The [filter]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
name

The technical name of the filter. It can be used to
`enable it by default
<reference/view_architectures/search/defaults>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} or as an `inheritance hook
<reference/view_records/inheritance>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The label of the filter.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
help

The tooltip displayed when hovering the filter.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
domain

The domain to append to the action\'s domain as part of the search
domain.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [\[\]]{.title-ref}
:::

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
date

The name of the [date]{.title-ref} or [datetime]{.title-ref} field to
filter on.

When used, this attribute creates a set of filters available in a
sub-menu of the `Filters`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} menu. The
available filters are time-dependent but not dynamic in the sense that
their domains are evaluated at the time of the control panel
instantiation.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter string=\"Creation Date\" name=\"filter_create_date\"
date=\"create_date\"/\>
:::

By default, these filters contain a dropdown with different sub-filters
that allow you to filter based on months, quarters and years.
Additionally, you can create custom sub-filters that allow filtering
using domains. These custom filters must have the following attributes:
[name]{.title-ref}, [string]{.title-ref} and [domain]{.title-ref}.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter string=\"Creation Date\" name=\"filter_create_date\" date=\"create_date\"\>

:   \<filter name=\"create_date_last_30_days\" string=\"Last 30 Days\"
    domain=\"\[(\'create_date\', \'&gt;\',
    datetime.datetime.combine(context_today() - relativedelta(days=30),
    datetime.time(23, 59, 59)).to_utc())\]\"/\>

\</filter\>
:::

Note that all custom filters defined this way are mutually exclusive
with each other and with the other sub-filters.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
start_month

The earliest month that will show up in the dropdown of a date filter,
as an offset relative to the current month.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter string=\"Creation Date\" name=\"filter_create_date\"
date=\"create_date\" start_month=\"-3\"/\>

If the current month is February, the earliest month selectable in the
dropdown will be November.
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   int

default
:   [-2]{.title-ref}

scope
:   Filters with a non-empty [date]{.title-ref} attribute
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
end_month

The latest month that will show up in the dropdown of a date filter, as
an offset relative to the current month.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter string=\"Creation Date\" name=\"filter_create_date\"
date=\"create_date\" end_month=\"2\"/\>

If the current month is February, the latest month selectable in the
dropdown will be March.
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   int

default
:   [0]{.title-ref}

scope
:   Filters with a non-empty [date]{.title-ref} attribute
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
start_year

The earliest year that will show up in the dropdown of a date filter, as
an offset relative to the current year.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter string=\"Creation Date\" name=\"filter_create_date\"
date=\"create_date\" start_year=\"-3\"/\>

If the current year is 2024, the earliest year selectable in the
dropdown will be 2021.
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   int

default
:   [-2]{.title-ref}

scope
:   Filters with a non-empty [date]{.title-ref} attribute
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
end_year

The latest year that will show up in the dropdown of a date filter, as
an offset relative to the current year.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter string=\"Creation Date\" name=\"filter_create_date\"
date=\"create_date\" end_year=\"2\"/\>

If the current year is 2024, the latest year selectable in the dropdown
will be 2025.
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   int

default
:   [0]{.title-ref}

scope
:   Filters with a non-empty [date]{.title-ref} attribute
::::

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
default_period

The default period of the time-based filter (with a [date]{.title-ref}
attribute). It must be one of, or a comma-separated list of valid filter
ids.

Valid filter ids include the following:

- [first_quarter]{.title-ref}, [second_quarter]{.title-ref},
  [third_quarter]{.title-ref} and [fourth_quarter]{.title-ref}.
- One of [month]{.title-ref}, [month-x]{.title-ref} and
  [month+x]{.title-ref}, where [x]{.title-ref} is a non-zero integer
  value between [start_month]{.title-ref} and [end_month]{.title-ref}.
- One of [year]{.title-ref}, [year-x]{.title-ref} and
  [year+x]{.title-ref}, where [x]{.title-ref} is a non-zero integer
  value between [start_year]{.title-ref} and [end_year]{.title-ref}.
- The [name]{.title-ref} of any custom filter defined within the filter,
  prepended with [custom\_]{.title-ref}.

The filter must be in the default set of filters activated at the view
initialization.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter string=\"Creation Date\" name=\"filter_create_date\"
date=\"create_date\" default_period=\"year,month-1\"/\>
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter string=\"Creation Date\" name=\"filter_create_date\" date=\"create_date\" default_period=\"custom_create_date_last_30_days\"\>

:   \<filter name=\"create_date_last_30_days\" string=\"Last 30 Days\"
    domain=\"\[(\'create_date\', \'&gt;\',
    datetime.datetime.combine(context_today() - relativedelta(days=30),
    datetime.time(23, 59, 59)).to_utc())\]\"/\>

\</filter\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [month]{.title-ref}, or the closest value to the current month if
    unavailable

scope
:   Filters with a non-empty [date]{.title-ref} attribute
:::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
invisible

Whether the element is visible ([False]{.title-ref}) or hidden
([True]{.title-ref}), as a Python expression that evaluates to a bool.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are two uses for the [invisible]{.title-ref} attribute:

- Usability: to avoid overloading the view and to make it easier for the
  user to read, depending on the content.
- Technical: a field must be present (invisible is enough) in the view
  to be used in a Python expression.
::::

::: example
``` xml
<field name="fname_b" invisible="fname_c != 3 and fname_a == parent.fname_d"/>
<group invisible="fname_c != 4">
    <field name="fname_c"/>
    <field name="fname_d"/>
<group>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
::::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups

The comma-separated list of user groups to whom the element is
displayed. Users who do not belong to at least one of these groups are
unable to see the element. Groups can be prefixed with the negative
[!]{.title-ref} operator to exclude them.

::: example
``` xml
<field name="FIELD_NAME" groups="base.group_no_one,!base.group_multi_company"/>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

:::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
context

The context merged into the action\'s domain to generate the search
domain

The context key [group_by]{.title-ref} set with a field as value can be
used to define a group available in the `Group By`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} menu. When the field is of type [date]{.title-ref} or
[datetime]{.title-ref}, the filter generates a submenu of the
`Group By`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} menu with the following
interval options available: `Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Quarter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Month`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter string=\"Category\" name=\"groupby_category\"
context=\"{\'group_by\': \'category_id\'}\"/\> \<filter
string=\"Creation Date\" name=\"groupby_create_date\"
context=\"{\'group_by\': \'create_date:week\'}\"/\>
:::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The results of [formatted_read_group]{.title-ref} grouped on a field may
be influenced by its [group_expand]{.title-ref} attribute, allowing to
display empty groups when needed. For more information, please refer to
`~odoo.fields.Field`{.interpreted-text role="class"}.
::::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [{}]{.title-ref}
::::::

:::::: caution
::: title
Caution
:::

Sequences of filters (without non-filters elements separating them) are
treated as inclusively composited: they will be composed with
[OR]{.title-ref} rather than the usual [AND]{.title-ref}.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter domain=\"\[(\'state\', \'=\', \'draft\')\]\"/\> \<filter
domain=\"\[(\'state\', \'=\', \'done\')\]\"/\>

Records whose [state]{.title-ref} field is [draft]{.title-ref} or
[done]{.title-ref} are shown.
:::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<filter domain=\"\[(\'state\', \'=\', \'draft\')\]\"/\> \<separator/\>
\<filter domain=\"\[(\'delay\', \'&lt;\', 15)\]\"/\>

Records whose [state]{.title-ref} field is [draft]{.title-ref} **and**
[delay]{.title-ref} field is below 15.
:::
::::::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/search_filter.svg){.align-center}             |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                                   |
| <search>                                                                  |
|     <filter string="My Custom Name" domain="[('name', 'ilike', 'AAA')]"/> |
|     <filter string="My orders" domain="[('user_id', '=', uid)]"/>         |
|     <filter string="Category" context="{'group_by': 'category_id'}"/>     |
| </search>                                                                 |
| ```                                                                       |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### \`separator\`: separate groups of filters {#reference/view_architectures/search/separator}

The [separator]{.title-ref} element is used to separates groups of
`filters
<reference/view_architectures/search/filter>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} in simple search views. For more complex search views, the
`group <reference/view_architectures/search/group>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} element is recommended.

``` xml
<search>
    <FILTERS/>
    <separator/>
    <FILTERS/>
</search>
```

The [separator]{.title-ref} element takes no attributes.

#### \`group\`: separate groups of filters {#reference/view_architectures/search/group}

The [group]{.title-ref} element is used to separate groups of `filters
<reference/view_architectures/search/filter>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} in cluttered search views. In simpler search views, it can
be substituted for the
`separator <reference/view_architectures/search/group>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} element.

``` xml
<search>
    <group>
        <FILTERS/>
    </group>
</search>
```

The [group]{.title-ref} element takes no attributes.

#### \`searchpanel\`: display search panels {#reference/view_architectures/search/searchpanel}

The [searchpanel]{.title-ref} element displays a search panel to the
left of multi-records views. It allows for quickly filtering data on the
basis of given fields.

``` xml
<search>
    <searchpanel>
        <FIELDS/>
    </searchpanel>
</search>
```

The [searchpanel]{.title-ref} element accepts only [field]{.title-ref}
children elements.

The [field]{.title-ref} element used as a child element of a
[searchpanel]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
name

The name of the field to filter on.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The label of the field.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   The [string]{.title-ref} attribute of the model\'s field
:::

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
select

The behavior and display of the field. It can have two different values:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
one

At most one value can be selected. Supported field types are
[many2one]{.title-ref} and [selection]{.title-ref}.
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
multi

Several values can be selected. Supported field types are
[many2one]{.title-ref}, [many2many]{.title-ref} and
[selection]{.title-ref}.
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [one]{.title-ref}
:::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groups

The comma-separated list of user groups to whom the element is
displayed. Users who do not belong to at least one of these groups are
unable to see the element. Groups can be prefixed with the negative
[!]{.title-ref} operator to exclude them.

::: example
``` xml
<field name="FIELD_NAME" groups="base.group_no_one,!base.group_multi_company"/>
```
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
icon

The icon of the field.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
color

The color of the field.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

When the [field]{.title-ref} element has the [select=one]{.title-ref}
attribute set, it can have the following additional attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
hierarchize

Whether child categories should appear under their parent category, or
at the same hierarchy level.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}

scope
:   `~odoo.fields.Many2one`{.interpreted-text role="class"} fields
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
depth

If set to a non zero integer, the hierarchy (if any) will be unfold up
to the given level.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   integer

default
:   [0]{.title-ref}

scope
:   `~odoo.fields.Many2one`{.interpreted-text role="class"} fields
:::

When the [field]{.title-ref} element has the [select=multi]{.title-ref}
attribute set, it can have the following additional attributes:

::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
enable_counters

Whether the record counters is computed and displayed if non-zero.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

This attribute exists to avoid impacting performance. Another way to
address performance issues is to override the
[search_panel_select_range]{.title-ref} and
[search_panel_select_multi_range]{.title-ref} methods.
::::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
:::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
expand

Whether categories and filters with no records should be shown.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
limit

The maximal number of values to fetch for the field. If the limit is
reached, no values are displayed on the search panel, and an error
message is shown instead. If set to 0, all values are fetched.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   int

default
:   [200]{.title-ref}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
domain

The conditions that the records have to satisfy.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<searchpanel\>

:   \<field name=\"department_id\"/\> \<field name=\"manager_id\"
    select=\"multi\" domain=\"\[(\'department_id\', \'=\',
    department_id)\]\"/\>

\</searchpanel\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   `Python expression <reference/view_architectures/python_expression>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

default
:   [\[\]]{.title-ref}
::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
groupby

The name of the field name on which values should be grouped.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}

scope
:   `~odoo.fields.Many2one`{.interpreted-text role="class"} and
    `~odoo.fields.Many2many`{.interpreted-text role="class"} fields
:::

### Search defaults {#reference/view_architectures/search/defaults}

Search fields and filters can be configured through the action\'s
[context]{.title-ref} using `search_default_{name}`{.interpreted-text
role="samp"} keys. For fields, the value must be the value to set to the
field. For filters, it must be a boolean value or a number.

::: example
With [foo]{.title-ref}, a field, and [bar]{.title-ref}, a filter, the
following action context will search [foo]{.title-ref} on
[acro]{.title-ref} and enable [bar]{.title-ref} by default:

``` python
{
    'search_default_foo': 'acro',
    'search_default_bar': 1
}
```
:::

A numeric value (between 1 and 99) can be used to define the order of
default *groupby* filters.

::: example
With [foo]{.title-ref} and [bar]{.title-ref}, two *groupby* filters, the
following action context will first enable [bar]{.title-ref}, then
[foo]{.title-ref}.

``` python
{
    'search_default_foo': 2,
    'search_default_bar': 1
}
```
:::

## Kanban {#reference/view_architectures/kanban}

Kanban views are used as a [kanban
board](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanban_board) visualisation: they
display records as \"cards\", halfway between a `list
<reference/view_architectures/list>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and a
`form <reference/view_architectures/form>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
view.

Records may be grouped in columns for use in workflow visualisation or
manipulation (e.g., tasks or work-progress management), or ungrouped
(used simply to visualize records).

The root element of Kanban views is [kanban]{.title-ref}.

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+--------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/kanban.svg){.align-center} |
+--------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                |
| <kanban>                                               |
|     ...                                                |
| </kanban>                                              |
| ```                                                    |
+--------------------------------------------------------+
:::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Kanban views load and display a maximum of ten columns. Any column after
that is closed but can still be opened by the user.
::::

### Root attributes {#reference/view_architectures/kanban/root}

Optional attributes can be added to the root element
[kanban]{.title-ref} to customize the view.

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
string

The view title. It is displayed only if you open an action that has no
name and whose target is [new]{.title-ref} (opening a dialog).

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
create

Disable/enable record creation on the view.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
edit

Disable/enable record edition on the view.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
delete

Disable/enable record deletion on the view through the
`Action`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dropdown.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
default_group_by

The name of the field on which the records should be grouped by default
if no grouping is specified via the action or the current
`search <reference/view_architectures/search>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
default_order

A comma-separated list of fields names that overrides the ordering
defined on the model through the
`~odoo.models.BaseModel._order`{.interpreted-text role="attr"}
attribute.

To inverse the sorting order of a field, postfix it with
[desc]{.title-ref}, separated by a space.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<list default_order=\"sequence,name desc\"\>

:   \...

\</list\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}

Add HTML classes to the root HTML element of the view.

requirement
:   Optional

:   str

:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}

The key in the [KanbanExamplesRegistry]{.title-ref} of the examples that
can be browsed when creating a new column in the grouped kanban view.

::: seealso
[Use of the examples attribute in the utm
module]({GITHUB_PATH}/addons/utm/static/src/js/utm_campaign_kanban_examples.js)
:::

requirement

:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
group_create

Whether the `Add a new column`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} bar is

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
group_delete

Whether columns can be deleted via the cog menu.

requirement
:   Optional

Whether columns can be edited via the cog menu.

Whether records can be dragged when the kanban view is grouped.

:   Optional

type
:   bool

:   [True]{.title-ref}

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
archivable

Whether records belonging to a column can be archived and unarchived
when the [active]{.title-ref} field is defined on the model.

requirement
:   Optional

:   bool

:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
quick_create

Whether it should be possible to create records without switching to the

requirement
:   Optional

type

default
:   [True]{.title-ref} when the kanban view is grouped by many2one,
    selection, char, or boolean fields, otherwise [False]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
quick_create_view

The reference of the
`form <reference/view_architectures/form>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
view to open when using the quick creation of records.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
on_create

The custom action to call when clicking on `Create`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

If set to [\'quick_create\']{.title-ref}, the quick creation of records
is used instead. If the quick creation is disabled, the standard create
action is called.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
can_open

By default, clicking on a kanban card opens the corresponding record in
a form view. This behavior can be disabled by setting the attribute
[can_open]{.title-ref} to [False]{.title-ref}.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [True]{.title-ref}
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
highlight_color

Name of the integer field used to color the left border of the kanban
cards.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}

Whether the view should be populated with a set of sample records if
none are found for the current model.

These fake records have heuristics for certain field names/models. For
example, a field [display_name]{.title-ref} on the model
[res.users]{.title-ref} will be populated with sample people names,
while an [email]{.title-ref} field will be in the form
[firstname.lastname@sample.demo]{.title-ref}.

The user is unable to interact with these data, and they will be
discarded as soon as an action is performed (record created, column
added, etc.).

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   bool

default
:   [False]{.title-ref}
:::

### Components {#reference/view_architectures/kanban/components}

Kanban views accept the following children elements: `templates
<reference/view_architectures/kanban/templates>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `field
<reference/view_architectures/kanban/field>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `header
<reference/view_architectures/kanban/header>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `progressbar
<reference/view_architectures/kanban/progressbar>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

#### \`templates\`: define cards structure {#reference/view_architectures/kanban/templates}

The [templates]{.title-ref} element is used to define the
`QWeb templates <reference/qweb>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} that
structure the kanban cards.

The definition of a card\'s structure can be split into multiple
templates for clarity, but at least one root [card]{.title-ref} template
must be defined.

An additional template can be defined: [menu]{.title-ref}. If defined,
it is rendered inside a dropdown that can be toggled with a vertical
ellipsis (`⋮`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) on the top right of
the card.

The templates are written in
`JavaScript QWeb <reference/qweb/javascript>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

``` xml
<kanban>
   <templates>
      <t t-name="card">
         <field name="name"/>
      </t>
   </templates>
</kanban>
```

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

These are QWeb templates, not [Owl](https://github.com/odoo/owl)
templates, meaning that directives like [t-on-click]{.title-ref} aren\'t
available.
::::

##### Fields

Inside those templates, the [field]{.title-ref} element allows to render
a field. It can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
name

The name of the field to render.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
widget

The widget used to represent the field. The selected widget can change
the way the field is rendered and/or the way it can be edited. It refers
to a Javascript implementation (an Owl component) registered to the
[fields]{.title-ref} registry.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str
:::

By default, field nodes are replaced by a [span]{.title-ref} containing
their formatted value, unless the [widget]{.title-ref} attribute is
specified, in which case their rendering and behavior depends on the
corresponding widget. The [widget]{.title-ref} attribute can have
different values including:

> ::: {.attribute noindex=""}
> handle
>
> Allows reordering records with a drag and drop, using the
> corresponding field as order.
> :::
>
> ::: {.attribute noindex=""}
> kanban_color_picker
>
> Allows editing a color (integer) field. Combined with the root
> attribute [highlight_color]{.title-ref}, allows editing the color of
> the cards.
> :::

See the `Field section <reference/js/widgets>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to discover various widgets and their options.

##### Rendering Context

Kanban templates being rendered with the
`QWeb engine <reference/qweb/javascript>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
they have a *rendering context*, a set of variables available in the
templates, containing useful information and tools. Here\'re the
available variables:

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
record

An object with all the fields defined in the view. Each field has two
attributes: [value]{.title-ref} and [raw_value]{.title-ref}. The former
is formatted according to current user parameters, while the latter is
the raw value (e.g. the [id]{.title-ref} for a many2one field). This
object is useful for instance, for using field values inside
[t-if]{.title-ref} conditions. For display purposes, we recommend using
the [\<field\>]{.title-ref} tag.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<kanban\>

:   

    \<templates\>

    :   \<field name=\"is_company\"/\> \<t t-name=\"card\"\> \<field
        name=\"name\"/\> \<field t-if=\"!record.is_company.raw_value\"
        name=\"parent_id\"\> \</t\>

    \</templates\>

\</kanban\>
:::
::::

:::: {.attribute noindex=""}
widget

An object with 2 keys defining the available actions for the user:

- \`editable\`: true if the user can edit records, false otherwise;
- \`deletable\`: true if the user can delete records, false otherwise.

This is useful to conditionally display elements requiring specific
access rights.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<kanban\>

:   

    \<templates\>

    :   

        \<t t-name=\"card\"\>

        :   \<field name=\"name\"/\>

        \</t\> \<t t-name=\"menu\"\> \<a t-if=\"widget.deletable\"
        role=\"menuitem\" type=\"delete\"
        class=\"dropdown-item\"\>Delete\</a\> \</t\>

    \</templates\>

\</kanban\>
:::
::::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
context

The current context propagated from either the action that opens the
kanban view, or the one2many or many2many field that embeds the kanban
view in a form view.
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
read_only_mode

Indicates that the view is readonly.

type
:   bool
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
selection_mode

Whether the kanban view is opened when selecting a many2one or many2many
field (in mobile environment).

type
:   bool
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
luxon

The [luxon](https://moment.github.io/luxon/api-docs/index.html) object,
allowing to manipulate date and datetime field values.
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
JSON

The Javascript
[JSON](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON)
namespace object containing a [parse]{.title-ref} method allowing to
parse json field values into Javascript Objects.
:::

##### Buttons and links

While most of the kanban templates are standard
`QWeb templates <reference/qweb>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, the
kanban view processes [button]{.title-ref} and [a]{.title-ref} elements
is a special way. Buttons and links with a [type]{.title-ref} attribute
perform different operations than their standard HTML function. The
[type]{.title-ref} attribute can have the values [action]{.title-ref}
and [object]{.title-ref} of
`regular buttons <reference/view_architectures/list/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, or the following values:

> ::: {.attribute noindex=""}
> open
>
> Clicking the element opens the card\'s record in form view.
> :::
>
> ::: {.attribute noindex=""}
> delete
>
> Clicking the element deletes the card\'s record and removes the card.
> :::
>
> ::: {.attribute noindex=""}
> archive
>
> Clicking the element archives the card\'s record and removes the card.
> :::
>
> ::: {.attribute noindex=""}
> unarchive
>
> Clicking the element unarchives the card\'s record and removes the
> card.
> :::
>
> ::: {.attribute noindex=""}
> set_cover
>
> Clicking the element allows to select an image to set as cover image
> of the record.
> :::

##### Widgets

The [widget]{.title-ref} element allows to insert dynamically generated
(in Javascript) html inside the cards. It has a mandatory
[name]{.title-ref} attribute, referring to a Javascript implementation
(an Owl component) registered to the [view_widgets]{.title-ref}
registry.

See the
`Widget section <reference/javascript_reference/view_widgets>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to discover various widgets and their options.

##### Layouts

Several card layouts can be easily obtained using standard html elements
and [Bootstrap utility
classes](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/utilities/api/). By default,
the card is a [flexbox
container](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_flexible_box_layout/Basic_concepts_of_flexbox)
with [column]{.title-ref} direction.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<kanban\>

:   

    \<templates\>

    :   

        \<t t-name=\"card\"\>

        :   \<field class=\"fw-bold fs-5\" name=\"display_name\"/\>
            \<field class=\"text-muted\" name=\"parent_id\"/\> \<field
            name=\"tag_ids\" widget=\"many2many_tags\"/\>

        \</t\>

    \</templates\>

\</kanban\>
:::

The [footer]{.title-ref} html element is styled to stick to the bottom
of the card, and is as a flexbox container with [row]{.title-ref}
direction, allowing to easily display several fields on the same line.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<kanban\>

:   

    \<templates\>

    :   

        \<t t-name=\"card\"\>

        :   \<field class=\"fw-bold fs-5\" name=\"display_name\"/\>
            \<field class=\"text-muted\" name=\"parent_id\"/\> \<field
            name=\"tag_ids\" widget=\"many2many_tags\"/\> \<footer\>
            \<field name=\"priority\" widget=\"priority\"/\> \<!\--
            bottom left corner \--\> \<field class=\"ms-auto\"
            name=\"activity_ids\" widget=\"kanban_activity\"/\> \<!\--
            bottom right corner \--\> \</footer\>

        \</t\>

    \</templates\>

\</kanban\>
:::

To display some content, like an image, on the side of the card, one can
use [aside]{.title-ref} and [main]{.title-ref} html elements, with the
[flex-row]{.title-ref} classname on the card. The [main]{.title-ref}
node is a flexbox container like the card is when there\'s no
[aside]{.title-ref}.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<kanban\>

:   

    \<templates\>

    :   

        \<t t-name=\"card\" class=\"flex-row\"\>

        :   

            \<aside\>

            :   \<field name=\"avatar_128\" widget=\"image\"
                alt=\"Avatar\"/\>

            \</aside\> \<main class=\"ms-2\"\> \<field class=\"fw-bold
            fs-5\" name=\"display_name\"/\> \<field class=\"text-muted\"
            name=\"parent_id\"/\> \<field name=\"tag_ids\"
            widget=\"many2many_tags\"/\> \<footer\> \<field
            name=\"priority\" widget=\"priority\"/\> \<field
            class=\"ms-auto\" name=\"activity_ids\"
            widget=\"kanban_activity\"/\> \</footer\> \</main\>

        \</t\>

    \</templates\>

\</kanban\>
:::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The classname [o_kanban_aside_full]{.title-ref} set on the
[aside]{.title-ref} element removes the padding so that the image
spreads to the borders of the card.
::::

#### \`field\`: declare more fields to fetch {#reference/view_architectures/kanban/field}

The [field]{.title-ref} element can also be used *outside* the kanban
`templates
<reference/view_architectures/kanban/templates>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. In that case, it allows to declare fields that are not
displayed in the card, but still need to be fetched, for instance
because their value is used in a [t-if]{.title-ref} condition.

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<kanban\>

:   

    \<templates\>

    :   \<field name=\"is_company\"/\> \<t t-name=\"card\"\> \<field
        name=\"name\"/\> \<field t-if=\"!record.is_company.raw_value\"
        name=\"parent_id\"\> \</t\>

    \</templates\>

\</kanban\>
:::

#### \`header\`: display buttons in the control panel {#reference/view_architectures/kanban/header}

The [header]{.title-ref} element is used to insert custom buttons in the
control panel.

``` xml
<kanban>
   <header>
      ...
   </header>
   ...
</kanban>
```

The [header]{.title-ref} element accepts only [button]{.title-ref}
children elements, similar to `list views' button
<reference/view_architectures/list/button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} elements.

The [button]{.title-ref} element used as a child element of the
[header]{.title-ref} element can have the following additional
attributes:

:::::::: {.attribute noindex=""}
display

The display mode of the button. It can have two different values:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
display

The button is displayed only when some records are selected; their
action applies to the selected records.
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
always

The button is displayed at all times, even if no records are selected.
:::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Only the [always]{.title-ref} display mode is available because it is
not yet possible to select records in a kanban view.
::::

::: example
.. code-block:: xml

\<header\>

:   \<button name=\"toDoAlways\" type=\"object\" string=\"Always
    displayed\" display=\"always\"/\> \<button name=\"toDoSelection\"
    type=\"object\" string=\"Displayed if selection\"/\>

\</header\>
:::

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [display]{.title-ref}
::::::::

#### \`progressbar\`: show progress bars on top of columns {#reference/view_architectures/kanban/progressbar}

The [progressbar]{.title-ref} element is used to define a progress bar
to display on top of kanban columns in grouped kanban views.

``` xml
<kanban>
    <progressbar field="FIELD_NAME"/>
    ...
</kanban>
```

The [progressbar]{.title-ref} element can have the following attributes:

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
field

The name of the field on which the progress bar\'s sub-groups are based.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   str
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
colors

The mapping of the progress bar\'s field values to the color values
[muted]{.title-ref}, [success]{.title-ref}, [warning]{.title-ref}, and
[danger]{.title-ref}.

requirement
:   Mandatory

type
:   [JSON](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON)
:::

::: {.attribute noindex=""}
sum_field

The name of the field to use in a sum displayed next to the progress
bar. If not set, the total number of records is displayed instead.

requirement
:   Optional

type
:   str

default
:   [\'\']{.title-ref}
:::

::: admonition
Possible structure and representation of its rendering

+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ![image](view_architectures/kanban_progressbar.svg){.align-center}                        |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ``` xml                                                                                   |
| <kanban>                                                                                  |
|     <progressbar field="activity_state"                                                   |
|                  colors="{'planned': 'success', 'today': 'warning', 'overdue': 'danger'}" |
|                  sum_field="expected_revenue"/>                                           |
|     <templates>                                                                           |
|         ...                                                                               |
|     </templates>                                                                          |
| </kanban>                                                                                 |
| ```                                                                                       |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

#### \`control\`: customize create and delete actions

Like for
`list views <reference/view_architectures/list/control>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
